abstract: After several years of impressive growth, state tax revenues seem to have hit a wall in the second half of 2006.
snippet: After several years of impressive growth, state tax revenues seem to have hit a wall in the second half of 2006.
lead_paragraph: AT Wal-Mart, whose sales depend on the fortunes of the broad consuming public, sales growth has been sluggish. At Saks, which caters to shoppers with more disposable income, sales growth has been impressive. It’s as if these two national retailers are operating in two different economies.

headline.main: Are Tax Revenues Flashing Red or Green?
headline.print_headline: Are Tax Revenues Flashing Red or Green?
